abstract.t: This document analyzes the scenario in which DHCPv4 interaction is performed over IP-IP tunnel, and proposes methods to keep DHCP working under such situation. The main issue is encapsulation of DHCP packets on server side, and there are both in-protocol and out- of-protocol solutions for this issue. The in-protocol solution is to have DHCP carrying the encapsulation address information, and the out-of-protocol solution is to have the DHCP server keeping track of the address mapping by inspecting DHCP packets.
